Let (f g : R[x, y]) are MvPolynomials. Mathematically, the proof is as follows

f(x,y)=f(x,y)−f(a,y)=∑i=0:nxigi(y)−∑i=0:naigi(y)=∑i=0:n(xi−ai)gi(y)=∑i=1:n(xi−ai)gi(y)=(x−a)g~(x,y)\begin{aligned} & f(x, y) = f(x, y) - f(a,y) = \sum_{i = 0:n}x^ig_i(y) - \sum_{i = 0:n}a^ig_i(y) = \sum_{i = 0:n}(x^i - a^i)g_i(y) \\ = &\sum_{i = 1:n}(x^i - a^i)g_i(y) = (x - a)\tilde{g}(x,y) \end{aligned}=​f(x,y)=f(x,y)−f(a,y)=i=0:n∑​xigi​(y)−i=0:n∑​aigi​(y)=i=0:n∑​(xi−ai)gi​(y)i=1:n∑​(xi−ai)gi​(y)=(x−a)g~​(x,y)​

But how to prove it in lean4? Seems first step f(x, y) =sum x^i * g(y) is key. I looked in the theorem library and didn't find a similar result. I guess the result might be in some advanced way in the library that I can't understand yet.

This is probably easiest to prove if you replace R[x,y] by R[X][X], in which case you can use Polynomial.dvd_iff_isRoot with R := R[X]. If you do want to use MvPolynomial, you can use the isomorphisms MvPolynomial.optionEquivRight, MvPolynomial.pUnitAlgEquiv and MvPolynomial.renameEquiv but it looks cumbersome.

import Mathlib
open MvPolynomial
variable (R : Type*) [CommRing R]
/-- f(x,y) = ∑_{i = 0:n} x^i * g_i(y) -/
noncomputable def buildPolynomialFromCoeffs (gs : ℕ → MvPolynomial (Fin 1) R) (n : ℕ) : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R :=
  (finSuccEquiv R 1).symm (∑ i ∈ Finset.range (n + 1), Polynomial.monomial i (gs i))

@[simp]
theorem buildPolynomialFromCoeffs_eq_self (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R] (f : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R) :
    buildPolynomialFromCoeffs R (finSuccEquiv R 1 f).coeff (finSuccEquiv R 1 f).natDegree = f := by
  unfold buildPolynomialFromCoeffs
  rw [← Polynomial.as_sum_range', AlgEquiv.symm_apply_apply]; omega

theorem mv_polynomial_factor_x_minus_a {R : Type*} [CommRing R] {a : R}
    (f : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R)
    (h : (MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv R 1 f).eval (C a) = 0) :
    ∃ g : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R, f = (X 0 - C a) * g := by
    rw [← Polynomial.IsRoot.def, ← Polynomial.dvd_iff_isRoot] at h
    obtain ⟨g, hg⟩ := h
    use ((finSuccEquiv R 1).symm g)
    rw [← AlgEquiv.symm_apply_apply (finSuccEquiv R 1) f]
    rw [show (_ - C a) = (finSuccEquiv R 1).symm (Polynomial.X - Polynomial.C (C a)) by
      rw [AlgEquiv.eq_symm_apply]
      simp [MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv]]
    simp_all

    (f : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R)
    (h : aeval (fun i => if i = 0 then X (0 : Fin 2) else C b) f = 0) :
    ∃ g : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R, f = (X 1 - C b) * g := by
  let f' := rename (Equiv.swap 0 1) f
  have h' : aeval ![C b, X 0] f' = (0: MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R) := by
    simp_rw [f', ← h, aeval_rename]; congr 2

You have to use MvPolynomial.optionEquivLeft or a similar lemma (they're all in the same file) to move from R[X,Y]R[X,Y]R[X,Y] to R[X][Y]R[X][Y]R[X][Y]. It depends on the precise formulation you have, but all the lemmas should be there.

You can use docs#MonomialOrder.div with the monomial order docs#MonomialOrder.degLex to get a factorization f(x,y)=(x−a)g(x,y)+r(x,y)f(x,y)=(x-a) g(x,y)+r(x,y)f(x,y)=(x−a)g(x,y)+r(x,y), where rrr has degree 000 in xxx, and prove that r=0r=0r=0.

import Mathlib.Data.Finsupp.MonomialOrder.DegLex
import Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.Groebner

variable (R : Type*) [CommRing R] (σ : Type*) [DecidableEq σ]

open MvPolynomial MonomialOrder

theorem exists_wellFoundedGT (α : Type u) :
    ∃ (_ : LinearOrder α), WellFoundedGT α := by
  obtain ⟨o, h⟩ := exists_wellOrder αᵒᵈ
  exact ⟨o.swap, h⟩

example (f : MvPolynomial σ R) (a : R) (x : σ)
    (h : f.aeval (fun s ↦ if s = x then C a else X s) = (0 : MvPolynomial σ R)) :
    ∃ g : MvPolynomial σ R, f = (X x - C a) * g := by
  nontriviality R
  let ⟨_, _⟩ := exists_wellFoundedGT σ
  obtain ⟨g, r, hf, hg, hr⟩ := degLex.div (ι := Unit) (b := fun _ ↦ X x - C a)
    (fun _ ↦ by rw [degLex.monic_X_sub_C x a]; exact isUnit_one) f
  simp only [Finsupp.linearCombination_unique] at hf hg
  use g ()
  rw [hf, mul_comm]
  convert add_zero _
  simp only [hf, PUnit.default_eq_unit, smul_eq_mul, map_add, map_mul, map_sub, aeval_X, ↓reduceIte,
    algHom_C, algebraMap_eq, sub_self, mul_zero, zero_add] at h
  rw [← h]
  conv_rhs => simp only [aeval, algebraMap_eq, AlgHom.coe_mk, coe_eval₂Hom, eval₂,
    ite_pow, Finsupp.sum]
  nth_rewrite 1 [MvPolynomial.as_sum r]
  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
  intro d hd
  simp only [MvPolynomial.monomial_eq]
  congr 1
  apply Finset.prod_congr rfl
  intro e he
  simp only
  split_ifs with hx
  · simp only [ne_eq, degree_X_sub_C, Finsupp.single_le_iff, not_le, Nat.lt_one_iff,
    forall_const, ← Finsupp.not_mem_support_iff] at hr
    exfalso
    apply hr d hd
    rwa [← hx]
  · rfl

I am not sure this is convincing, though, because the inner aspects are intricate and claim for lemmas.

  • exists_wellFoundedGT should be in Mathlib, because some constructions such as the lexicographic order require a WellFoundedGT order.

  • docs#MonomialOrder.div should maybe have a version for divisions by one or two polynomials, so that one is not forced to create a function.

  • the final rewriting was not so easy but a clever (?) simp [degLex.degree_X_sub_C] at hrsimplified a lot of things and made things a bit easier afterwards.

Now everything has been done at the case: "Fin 2". And a more general extension was also done by Antoine Chambert-Loir. Well.

lemma finsucc_eval_eq {R : Type*} [CommRing R] {a : R}
  (f : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R) :
  (finSuccEquiv R 1).symm ((finSuccEquiv R 1 f).aeval (Polynomial.C (C a : MvPolynomial (Fin 1) R))) = f.aeval ![C a, X (1 : Fin 2)] := by
  apply MvPolynomial.induction_on f
  . simp [MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv]
  . simp_all
  . intro p i hp; fin_cases i
    . simp_all [MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv]
    . simp [-aeval_eq_bind₁]; rw [hp]; congr 1
      rw [show X _ = X ((0 : Fin 1).succ) by rw [Fin.succ_zero_eq_one']]
      rw [finSuccEquiv_X_succ, Polynomial.aeval_C, Polynomial.algebraMap_eq, ← finSuccEquiv_X_succ, AlgEquiv.symm_apply_apply]

theorem MvPolynomial_factor_x_minus_a {R : Type*} [CommRing R] {a : R}
    (f : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R)
    (h : aeval ![C a, X 1] f = (0: MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R)) :
    ∃ g : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R, f = (X 0 - C a) * g := by
    replace h : (MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv R 1 f).eval (C a) = 0 := by
      rw [← finsucc_eval_eq, EmbeddingLike.map_eq_zero_iff] at h
      rw [← Polynomial.C_eq_zero, ← h]
      simp [Polynomial.aeval_def]
    rw [← Polynomial.IsRoot.def, ← Polynomial.dvd_iff_isRoot] at h
    obtain ⟨g, hg⟩ := h
    use ((finSuccEquiv R 1).symm g)
    rw [← AlgEquiv.symm_apply_apply (finSuccEquiv R 1) f]
    rw [show (_ - C a) = (finSuccEquiv R 1).symm (Polynomial.X - Polynomial.C (C a)) by
      simp [MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv]]
    simp_all

lemma aeval_of_Xi_eq {R : Type*} [CommRing R] {a : R}
  (f : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R):
  aeval ![C a, X 0] f = (0: MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R) ↔
  aeval ![C a, X 1] f = (0: MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R) := by
  refine ⟨fun h => ?_, fun h => ?_⟩
  . have : (f.aeval ![C a, X (0 : Fin 2)]).aeval ![X (1 : Fin 2), C a] = aeval ![C a, X 1] f := by
      apply MvPolynomial.induction_on f <;> try simp_all
      . intro p i hp; fin_cases i <;> try simp_all
    rw [h] at this; rw [← this, map_zero]
  . have : (f.aeval ![C a, X (1 : Fin 2)]).aeval ![C a, X (0 : Fin 2)] = aeval ![C a, X 0] f := by
      apply MvPolynomial.induction_on f <;> try simp_all
      . intro p i hp; fin_cases i <;> try simp_all
    rw [h] at this; rw [← this, map_zero]

theorem MvPolynomial_factor_x_minus_a_second {R : Type*} [CommRing R] {a : R}
  (f : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R)
  (h : aeval ![C a, X 0] f = (0: MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R)) :
  ∃ g : MvPolynomial (Fin 2) R, f = (X 0 - C a) * g := by
  rw [aeval_of_Xi_eq] at h
  exact MvPolynomial_factor_x_minus_a f h
